glucid Python Documentation¶

glucid is a software package that provides a glucid8824 module which provides a Command Line Interface and api as well as a Glucid8824 class that represents an instance of a Lucid ADA8824

Confirm the glucid8824 module can be imported¶

Within a Python3 interpreter, you may import he glucid8824 module:

>>> from glucid import glucid8824

Simple Example Setting Clock Sync Using Python¶

First, import glucid

>>> import glucid.glucid8824 as glucid

Create a new Glucid8824 object, by default this uses /dev/ttyUSB0

>>> mylucid = glucid.Glucid8824()

We connect to our ADA8824

>>> mylucid.connect()
True

Check the current clock sync source

>>> mylucid.get_sync_source()
'ADAT'

Set the clock sync to WordClock

>>> mylucid.set_sync_source(1)
>>> mylucid.get_sync_source()
'WordClock'

glucid8824 Module Documentation¶

glucid8824.py defines a class Glucid8824 which implements an api to a Lucid 8824 Analog/Digital Audio Converter RS232 interface over a serial port.

A main and associated functions provide a useful command line tool glucid to configure the Lucid 8824/.

glucid.glucid8824.get_all(lucid)¶

Get all possible values from the 8824 by calling each function sequentially

glucid.glucid8824.get_aes_src(lucid)¶

Call lucid8824.get_aes_source, exit on failure

glucid.glucid8824.get_analog_src(lucid)¶

Call lucid8824.get_analog_source, exit on failure

glucid.glucid8824.set_analog_src(lucid, srcval)¶

Call lucid8824.set_analog_src

glucid.glucid8824.get_opt_src(lucid)¶

Call lucid8824.get_opt_source, exit on failure

glucid.glucid8824.set_opt_src(lucid, srcval)¶

Call lucid8824.set_opt_src

glucid.glucid8824.get_meter(lucid)¶

Call lucid8824.get_meter, exit on failure

glucid.glucid8824.set_meter(lucid, meterval)¶

Call lucid8824.set_meter

glucid.glucid8824.get_sync(lucid)¶

Call lucid8824.get_sync, exit on failure

glucid.glucid8824.set_sync(lucid, syncval)¶

Call lucid8824.set_sync_source

glucid.glucid8824.get_dig1(lucid)¶

Call lucid8824.get_dig1, exit on failure

glucid.glucid8824.set_dig1(lucid, srcval)¶

Call lucid8824.set_dig1

glucid.glucid8824.get_gain(lucid)¶

Call lucid8824.get_get, exit on failure

glucid.glucid8824.set_gain_channels(lucid, gain=-99, channel_list=[])¶

Set the channels in channel_list to gain Write these values to the 8824

glucid.glucid8824.main()¶

Run the glucid8824 Command Line Interface

Glucid8824 Class Documentation¶

class glucid.glucid8824.Glucid8824(LucidID='00', siface='/dev/ttyUSB0', tout=1)¶

The Glucid8824 class represents a single Lucid ADA8824 unit and provides methods to communicate with a Lucid ADA8824 via its RS232 Serial port over the Serial Port of a Computer.

__init__(LucidID='00', siface='/dev/ttyUSB0', tout=1)¶

Define required data structures and serial interface

siface - serial interface, defaults to /dev/ttyUSB0 LucidID - The ID target of the Unit, defaults to 00 tout - serial timeout, in seconds, defaults to 1

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

clear_errorflag()¶

set error_flag and device_mismatch to False

connect()¶

Attempt to open a serial connection to self.siface

disconnect()¶

Close serial connection

static gain_int_to_db_string(intval)¶

Substract 96 and return the signed value as a string

getLinefromSerial()¶

Returns a line of data from the serial connection

getResponse(cmdkey, hexdata)¶

Parse the hex data received, set error flags if the repsponse is poorly formed

get_aes_source(RETSTRING=True)¶

Send the GetAesSrc command and Get the currently set source of AES Digital Output. Return String representation of result.

If RETSTRING is FALSE return the raw value

get_dig1(RETSTRING=True)¶

Get the source of Digital Channels 1,2 Input (AES of SPDIF) by sending the GetMode command

get_gain()¶

Populates the internal datastructure gainlist by sending the GetAnalogGain command to the 8824

get_iface()¶

Return the currently set serial interface

get_instanceid()¶

return the currently set instanceid without retrieving it first, instanceid defaults to 00 but is updated each time the Unit is read from

get_meter(RETSTRING=True)¶

Get the source for the front meters of the 8824

get_opt_source(RETSTRING=True)¶

Get the source of the ADAT Digit Input by sending the GetOptSrc command

get_sync_source(RETSTRING=True)¶

Get the source for clock sync and return a String representation

If RETSTRING is FALSE, return the raw value

static int_to_hex(intval)¶

A convenience function, use format to convert int to hex

isValidHexData(hexdata)¶

Check for a well formed instruction

log_gain_list(gainlist=False)¶

Log the current gainlist, for testing purposes

set_aes_src(srcval=False)¶

Set the source of the AES Digital OUTPUT.

srcval - 0 : ADAT IN
1 : Analog IN
set_analog_src(srcval=False)¶

Set the source of the Analog OUTPUT.

srcval - 0 : ADAT IN
1 : AES IN
set_dig1(srcval=False)¶

Set the source for Digital Channels 1,2:

srcval - 0 : AES
1 : S/PDIF
set_gainlist_all_stage(gain=-99, input_or_output=0)¶

Set all input or output channels to the same gain value

gain - integer -95 to 32

input_or_output - 0: INPUT
1: OUTPUT
set_meter(metersrc=False)¶

Set the source for front meters of the 8824

metersrc - 0 : Analog IN
1 : Digital IN 2 : Analog OUT 3 : Digital OUT
set_opt_src(srcval=False)¶

Set the source of the ADAT Digital OUTPUT.

srcval - 0 : Analog IN
1 : AES IN
set_sync_source(syncsrc=False, RETSTRING=True)¶

Set the source for clock sync

syncsrc - 0 : ADAT
1 : WordClock 2 : INTERNAL 44.1 3 : INTERNAL 48 4 : AES 1 5 : AES 2 6 : AES 3 7 : S/PDIF
update_channel_in_gainlist(gain=False, channel=False)¶

Update a single channel in the gain list, must have called get_gain to get the list from the 8824 first.

gain - value to set gain to -95 to +32 channel - channel to set

write_gainlist_to_lucid()¶

Convert gainlist to hex and call SetAnalogGain to write the values to the 8824
